content:
RuleSettings Class

Definition

Configures the ASP.NET event rules. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public sealed class RuleSettings : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
Inheritance
Object
System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
RuleSettings

Inherited Members

Remarks

Event rules determine which event, using which profile, is fired to which provider.

Constructors

RuleSettings(String,String,String)

Initializes a new instance of the RuleSettings class using default settings; however, the name, event name, and provider are specified.

public RuleSettings (string name, string eventName, string provider);
name
String

The name of the RuleSettings object to create.

eventName
String

The name of the EventMappingSettings object this rule applies to.

provider
String

The name of the ProviderSettings object this rule applies to.

Remarks

The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.

Property Default value
Custom An empty string ("").
MaxLimit MaxValue.
MinInstances 1.
MinInterval 0 ticks.
Profile An empty string ("").

RuleSettings(String,String,String,String,Int32,Int32,TimeSpan)

Initializes a new instance of the RuleSettings class where all values except those of the stem.Web.Configuration.RuleSettings.Custom* class are specified.

public RuleSettings (string name, string eventName, string provider, string profile, int minInstances, int maxLimit, TimeSpan minInterval);
name
String

The name of the RuleSettings object to create.

eventName
String

The name of the EventMappingSettings object this rule applies to.

provider
String

The name of the ProviderSettings object this rule applies to.

profile
String

The name of the ProfileSettings object this rule applies to.

minInstances
Int32

The minimum number of occurrences of the same type of event that can occur before the event is raised to the provider.

maxLimit
Int32

The maximum number of times events of the same type can be raised.

minInterval
TimeSpan

The minimum time interval between two events of the same type.

Remarks

The following table shows the default settings that are used for this constructor.

Property Default value
Custom An empty string ("").

RuleSettings(String,String,String,String,Int32,Int32,TimeSpan,String)

Initializes a new instance of the BufferModeSettings class where all values are specified.

public RuleSettings (string name, string eventName, string provider, string profile, int minInstances, int maxLimit, TimeSpan minInterval, string custom);
name
String

The name of the RuleSettings object to create.

eventName
String

The name of the EventMappingSettings object this rule applies to.

provider
String

The name of the ProviderSettings object this rule applies to.

profile
String

The name of the ProfileSettings object this rule applies to.

minInstances
Int32

The minimum number of occurrences of an event of the same type before the event is fired to the provider.

maxLimit
Int32

The maximum number of times events of the same type are fired.

minInterval
TimeSpan

The minimum time interval between two events of the same type.

custom
String

The fully qualified type of a custom class that implements IWebEventCustomEvaluator.

Remarks

You must provide every setting for this constructor.

Properties

Custom

Gets or sets the fully qualified type of a custom class that implements IWebEventCustomEvaluator.

public string Custom { get; set; }
Value
String

The fully qualified type of a custom class that implements IWebEventCustomEvaluator.

Remarks

The type reference is formed as follows (items in brackets are not required): Namespace.Typename, Assemblyname[,] [Version=x,] [Culture=y,] [PublicKeyToken=z]. For example, "ExampleNameSpace.ExampleType, Example.Assembly, Version=%ASSEMBLY_VERSION%, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=%MICROSOFT_PUBLICKEY%"

EventName

Gets or sets the name of the EventMappingSettings object this rule applies to.

public string EventName { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the EventMappingSettings object this rule applies to.

Remarks

The EventMappingSettings object referenced by this property must be contained by the same HealthMonitoringSection object that also contains this RuleSettings

object.

MaxLimit

Gets or sets the maximum number of times events of the same type are raised.

public int MaxLimit { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The maximum number of times events of the same type are raised. The default value is Int32.

Remarks

This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.

This represents the maximum number of times an event of the same type will be raised. For example, if the value is 10, then the event will be raised 10 times and ignored thereafter.

MinInstances

Gets or sets the minimum number of occurrences of the same type of event before the event is raised to the provider.

public int MinInstances { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The minimum number of occurrences of the same type of event before the event is raised to the provider. The default value is 1.

Remarks

This property must have a value greater than zero. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.

This represents the minimum number of times an event occurs before an event is raised to the provider. For example, if the return value is 5, then ASP.NET will not raise an event to the provider until the fifth instance of the event occurs.

MinInterval

Gets or sets the minimum time interval between two events of the same type.

public TimeSpan MinInterval { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

The minimum time interval between two events of the same type. The default value is 0 ticks.

Remarks

The value can be made infinite by setting it to MaxValue. Invalid values may cause an exception to be thrown when the configuration section is saved.

If the value is zero, then there is no minimum interval.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the RuleSettings object.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the RuleSettings object. The default value is an empty string ("").

Remarks

A unique name is required.

Profile

Gets or sets the name of the ProfileSettings object this rule applies to.

public string Profile { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the ProfileSettings object this rule applies to.

Remarks

The ProfileSettings object referenced by this property must be contained by the same HealthMonitoringSection object that also contains this RuleSettings

object.

Properties 

protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }
Value
ConfigurationPropertyCollection

To be added.

Provider

Gets or sets the name of the ProviderSettings object this rule applies to.

public string Provider { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the ProviderSettings object this rule applies to.

Remarks

The ProviderSettings object referenced by this property must be contained by the same HealthMonitoringSection object that also contains this RuleSettings object.
